meanings.definition: To predict or foretell the future based on signs or omens.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds augured a storm approaching.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature augured the arrival of winter.
meanings.sent3: The chirping of birds augured a surprise party in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The distant thunder augured trouble brewing in the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind augured a night filled with mystery and intrigue.

meanings.definition: To be a sign or indication of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The first snowflakes augured the beginning of the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The bright sunrise augured a beautiful day ahead.
meanings.sent3: The smell of fresh bread baking augured a delicious breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of bells augured the arrival of a festive parade.
meanings.sent5: The blooming flowers augured the start of springtime.
